title: Blue Cheese Foam Sequence
steps: For Blue Cheese Foam: Mix blue cheese, milk, and olive oil (reserving heavy cream) in a blender. Blend until smooth.
Pass mixture through a fine sieve.

Add heavy cream, season to taste with salt and pepper and stir. Keep in mind that the foam is going to expand 2 or 3 times in the ISI Whip so you need to season 2 or 3 times more than what you would normally do.
Pour mixture into ISI Whip, screw 1 cream charger (2 if using 1L ISI Whip) and shake vigorously after each one.
For Port Jelly: In a saucepan heat the port with Agar Agar over medium heat while you continuously whisk.
Let it simmer while whisking for 5 minutes to reduce the port a little and intensify the flavor.
Remove the saucepan from the heat and pass the mixture through a fine sieve to remove any bubbles.
Pour the Port and Agar mixture into a flat container to form a layer of 7mm (0.28 in) thick. Let it cool at room temperature on a flat surface.

Once the Port is jellified, cut it in 1 cm (0.4 in) squares using a knife. Use a small spatula to handle the squares. If you are not going to use them right away, store them in a sealed container in the fridge.
To Assemble: Get your Anti-Griddle ready (freeze a metal baking sheet or use dry ice).
For each serving, pump 5 dollops of blue cheese foam onto the Anti-Griddle. The dollop should be about 1.9 to 2.5 cm (3/4 to 1 inch) in diameter and 1.3 cm (1/2 inch) high.
Place the pairing ingredients on top of each dollop: walnut, celery, grape, pear and port jelly square.

If using a home-made Anti-Griddle, the total time the dollop should be on the cold surface is between 1½-2 minutes. The bottom should be frozen hard but the center and top of the dollop should be soft and at room temperature.
Transfer dollop to serving plate using a spatula. Serving plate should be cold so it gives you time to prepare all plates before serving.
notes: Volume conversions: 100g blue cheese ≈ 3.5 oz, 125ml heavy cream ≈ 125g, 70ml milk ≈ 70g, 40ml olive oil ≈ 40g, 140g port, 1g agar agar ≈ 0.7%, 4 walnuts ≈ 20g, 4 celery slices ≈ 20g, 4 pear slices ≈ 20g, 4 grape halves ≈ 20g
Requires special equipment: ISI Whip with cream chargers, Anti-Griddle or freezer-safe metal sheet
An Anti-Griddle is a molecular gastronomy equipment made by PolyScience - you can make a DIY version at home using a frozen metal baking sheet
Blue cheese foam pairs with walnuts, celery, port, pears and grapes - stimulates the senses with a variety of flavor pairings, temperatures and textures
For an extra twist, carbonate the grapes to make them fizzy and resemble champagne
